description: From Middle English somer-hous, from Old English sumerhūs, sumorhūs, equivalent to summer +‎ house. Compare Dutch zomerhuis, German Sommerhaus, Danish sommerhus, Swedish sommarhus.

entries.meaning: A house owned not as a primary residence and used as vacation home during warm weather months of the year.
An outbuilding in a garden where the owners can relax in warm weather.
